title: Quiz 3: Hormonal Contraceptives
description: Test your knowledge of Combined Oral Contraceptives (COCs), Progestin Only Pills (POPs), Injectables, and Implants.

questions.question: Which of the following are mechanisms of action for Combined Oral Contraceptives (COCs)? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Inhibits ovulation by suppressing FSH and LH
Thickens cervical mucus to block sperm passage

questions.explanation: COCs work primarily by inhibiting ovulation (suppressing FSH and LH), thickening cervical mucus to block sperm, and altering the endometrium to make it less receptive to implantation. They are not spermicidal.
questions.hint: Think about how hormones affect the menstrual cycle.

questions.question: Depo Provera (DMPA) is an injectable contraceptive given every __b1__ months (or __b2__ weeks).
questions.explanation: Depo Provera (DMPA) is administered intramuscularly every 3 months (12 weeks) for continuous contraceptive protection.

questions.question: Which client is a suitable candidate for Progestin Only Pills (POPs) but NOT Combined Oral Contraceptives (COCs)?

options.text: A woman with active liver disease
A woman with unexplained vaginal bleeding

questions.explanation: Breastfeeding mothers can use POPs after 6 weeks postpartum as they don't contain estrogen and won't suppress lactation. COCs contain estrogen which may reduce milk supply and are contraindicated in breastfeeding mothers <6 months postpartum.

questions.question: A woman who misses one Combined Oral Contraceptive pill should discard the pack and start a new one.
questions.explanation: If one pill is missed, she should take it as soon as remembered (even if taking two at once) and continue the pack. Discarding is not necessary. Missed pill protocols vary based on which week the pill was missed.
questions.hint: Think about standard missed pill guidelines.

questions.question: What is the effective duration of the Norplant/Jadelle implant?
questions.explanation: Implants such as Norplant and Jadelle generally offer continuous long-term contraceptive protection for 5 years, though some formulations may be effective for up to 7 years.

questions.question: Which of the following are common side effects of Progestin Only Pills (POPs)? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Common side effects of POPs include irregular bleeding patterns, amenorrhoea, headaches, and breast tenderness. Weight gain is not typically associated with POPs.
questions.hint: POPs have different side effect profiles than COCs.

questions.question: Arrange the phases of the menstrual cycle in the correct order as affected by hormonal contraceptives:
questions.explanation: Hormonal contraceptives work by disrupting this natural cycle, primarily by suppressing the LH surge and preventing ovulation.
questions.hint: Follow the natural menstrual cycle progression.
